body: @bobSir Does Weex Playground have the same problem on your phone?
问题已经解决，官网里面的执行脚本将 jsc.so 内置到项目的时候，默认路径和自己的静态库路径不一致，导致打包后静态库不完整，所以没能生成jsc.so文件

> Try use the release version, not debug version.
> 
> The android debug API have serious performance punishement on Weex.

Thanks for your help!
I builded an APP for Android, It's no problem.

I'm in the same corp. with bobSir, and I found something strange. In `multi_process_and_so_initializer.cpp` with function `Init`， the code has jumped into the case 
`if (sender == nullptr)` and throws the Exception `IPCException server died spinWaitPeer timeout` 
and `WeexJSConnection catch: spinWaitPeer timeout`。 

Expecting  to give some advice to us. Thanks any way.
Maybe you should have a look at  https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/3030
@hgc2002 You should ask question in [Weex-CLI](https://github.com/apache/weex-cli/issues), not here. Thanks.

There is nothing we can do for this problem.

Maybe you could look at https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/1887
Maybe you could look at the [documentation](https://weex.apache.org/zh/guide/advanced/multi-size-screen.html)
@jianhan-he Have a look?

感谢你的反馈，Weex目前是隶属于Apache Software Foundation的项目，因此在Gtihub渠道我们鼓励使用英文反馈问题。下面我将使用Google Trasnlate将你的问题翻译成英语，并以英语回答。

> [iOS] [iOS] list set bounce = 'false', haciendo que la lista no se deslice

There is nothing we can do without a [demo](http://dotwe.org/vue).
@jianhan-he Have a look ?
The issue is very similar with https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/3014

> @YorkShen This issue has a wide range of impact on iOS. More obvious is that the text is centered vertically.

@QC-L Sorry, I am not an iOS developer. Maybe @jianhan-he @wqyfavor could have a look.
@QC-L can you try like as :   font-family: PingFang SC

> The issue is very similar with #3014

Yes, They were both posted by me. Please help me to resolve this problem, thx

@YorkShen 

> 1. Try to upgrade to Weex 0.28
> 

We tried to upgrade to Weex 0.28.0, but app crashed: 
`dlopen failed: library "/system/lib/libc++_shared.so" needed`

> 2. Provide a stable reproducable case.
> 

We extracted user's `WXEvironment` who meet the problem, and found the `deviceWidth` is 2267 and the `deviceHeight` is 1080.

 That is to say, the page state seem like been rotated to landscape layout, but when user take screenshot, the page is still portrait layout. So there must be something wrong with these two paramaters.

So we found the stable reproducable case:

1. Let your app to be landscape;
2. Enter a Weex page;
3. Rotate your device to portrait;
4. Page rerendered, but not as we expected (`font-size` and `border-radius` recalculated, but `width`/`height` not).
@amiacoder Weex on iOS dont support iconfont. If you want to use iconfont that you can add attribute "coretext=false" on text tag. Like as <text  coretext=false></text>
@amiacoder You should never use iconfont as family-name. Can you try change another family-name?    https://weex.apache.org/docs/components/text.html#other
Our app has been solved by adding BindgingX, but WeexPlayground is not available. It is estimated that the problem is the weex SDK version

I solved this problem temporarily, and I found that some time-consuming operations in my application may block the initialization of jsFrameWork. My current approach is to listen for the time-consuming operations after the jsFrameWork initialization is complete.
But the same operation before 0.28.0, the initialization of jsFrameWork is normal. Maybe what weex can do?
If a classmate encounters the same problem as me, you can refer to my approach.

> @amiacoder Weex on iOS dont support iconfont. If you want to use iconfont that you can add attribute "coretext=false" on text tag. Like as

you are right! thx

Tried, but still not work.

jianhan-he <notifications@github.com> 于2019年11月25日周一 下午5:25写道：

> @QC-L <https://github.com/QC-L> can you try like as : font-family:
> PingFang SC
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/2859?email_source=notifications&email_token=ABAFNFVWZ5HQUEAEZ3KRUCTQVOKYBA5CNFSM4IR6QTP2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOEFBWU3A#issuecomment-558066284>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABAFNFV6BSLXDPRIWWOEDKTQVOKYBANCNFSM4IR6QTPQ>
> .
>

There are lots of log like this:

```
CoreText note: Client requested name ".SFUI-Regular", it will get TimesNewRomanPSMT rather than the intended font. All system UI font access should be through proper APIs such as CTFontCreateUIFontForLanguage() or +[UIFont systemFontOfSize:].
```

> But the same operation before 0.28.0, the initialization of jsFrameWork is normal. Maybe what weex can do?

If you suspect this is the problem of the new JSC, you can build Weex from source together with the legacy JSC. For detail of the build comand, you can look at the [travis command line](https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/blob/master/.travis.yml#L141)

Anyway, I will just close it. Feel free to contact me if there are any other problems.

I still suggest you upgrade to the Weex 0.28. Even if this is a bug and we fix it, you have to upgrade anyway.

> dlopen failed: library "/system/lib/libc++_shared.so" needed

`libc++_shared.so` is missing in your apk for some reason, and I'm sure `weex.aar` contains the file. You should check your build.gradle of your apk.

android的log级别分为v,d,i,w,e，这些log级别分别可以和console.verbose, console.debug 等映射。

然而`console.log`并无法映射到标准的 android 的 log 级别中。
Close this issue as it solved in https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/3014#issuecomment-558519447

The issue seems like solved, I'd like to close it.

Feel free to open a new one if there is other problem.
There is nothing we could do without a [demo](http://dotwe.org/vue).
@krimeshu which version of weexsdk do you use?   pr: https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/pull/2936  has already fix this bug.

bindingX not update，u can use "weex_sdk_legacy" to solve it.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/tree/master/android#build-types

> @krimeshu which version of weexsdk do you use? pr: #2936 has already fix this bug.

0.24.0
you can try the version of 0.28.0. It has already fixed. @krimeshu
Just as @topcloud-xx said, you could use `compile 'org.apache.weex:sdk_legacy:0.28.0'`, read the [documentation](https://weex.apache.org/zh/download/download.html#_0-28-0) here.

weex 的富文本只支持有限的子节点类型，具体可参见[文档](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/components/richtext.html#%E6%A0%B7%E5%BC%8F)。

`text` 不是富文本支持的子节点。

OutOfMemoery, you should do try to find the reason by yourself.

`DefaultWXHttpAdapter` is only for demo purpose, use it at your app in your own risk.
Duplicate with https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/issues/3039

Generated by :no_entry_sign: dangerJS against 152c0a1f015a801cf39169b834a01186dda2b67d

As it explained in the documentation, there are `sdk` and `sdk_legacy` in 0.28. 

* `org.apache.weex:sdk` is the currently stable package of Weex, where all Java files are under the package of `org.apache.weex`.
* `org.apache.weex:sdk_legacy` is the legacy package of Weex, where all Java files are under the package of `com.taobao.weex`. This artifact may not be maintained in the future, please upgrade to the new package name when it's possible for you.

Read the document carefully, many solutions are in the document, acutally.

For maps where the keys are of type integer, it's typically more efficient to use the Android SparseArray API. This check identifies scenarios where you might want to consider using SparseArray instead of HashMap for better performance.

This is particularly useful when the value types are primitives like ints, where you can use SparseIntArray and avoid auto-boxing the values from int to Integer.

If you need to construct a HashMap because you need to call an API outside of your control which requires a Map, you can suppress this warning using for example the @SuppressLint annotation.
To suppress this error, use the issue id "UseSparseArrays" as explained in the Suppressing Warnings and Errors section.

Try use [roundOffDeviation](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/modules/meta.html#setviewport)

Please provide a [demo](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/modules/meta.html#setviewport) next.

I'm pretty sure about Weex will only [save one file](https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/blob/7548ba6214ddfe16455cf03c577941f1dfb1ecdc/android/sdk/src/main/java/org/apache/weex/utils/WXViewToImageUtil.java#L90-L126) to your phone.

As for system gallery problem, I think this is the problem of Android system, and there are many similar issue you search in the internet.

Next time, please provide a [demo](dotwe.org).

You should ask developer of Webcore, not here.

有没有详细的统计，或者已知在什么设备上失效？
跟这个似乎存在关联 #3070
With such little information, I don't think anyone can help you.

**Short answer**: `.we` are not supported officially and there is no test case for it anymore, you may use it at your own risk.

**Long answer**: In Weex 0.28, we decoupled javascript interpreter from Weex and used JSC as the default Javascript interpreter, which is the reason of your problems. If you prefer `.we` support, just change it to the old `libJavaScriptCore.so`, you can check [travis file](https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/blob/master/.travis.yml#L144) for a demo.

**Background Information**: There are many hack code in the old `libJavaScriptCore.so` to support `.we` file, I am not surprised  that `.we` is not supported by other Javascript interpreter.
Without a demo, I don't think there is anyone could help you.
It worked well on my phone with Weex 0.28.

1. `libjsc.so` is in [jsc-android](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jsc-android), you should ask them.
2. According to my knowledge, `libjsc.so` only supports `armeabi-v7a`, `arm64-v8a`, `x86`. Check whether your device and apk run on these CPU architecture. If not, then this crash is normal, `libjsc.so` just doesn't support this case.

`onActivityCreate` 回调未正确执行，通常会导致一些 JS 事件无法发送，变量未初始化，很少会导致白屏。

你需要检查 `GraphicActionCreateBody`, `GraphicActionAddElement` 等对象是否被执行，这些对象是真正负责创建 View 的。

According to the [document](https://weex.apache.org/zh/docs/components/input.html), `font-weight` is not supported by `input`.

However, if you like, you could give us a PR for `font-weight` support in `input` by [adding a switch case for input](https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/blob/master/android/sdk/src/main/java/org/apache/weex/ui/component/AbstractEditComponent.java#L466).

I think the reason of this problem is that Vue framework in Weex doesn't send update command to client(Java or OC).

As I am not familiar with with front-end, I can't help you in this issue.

1. For ABI problems, both of your CPU architecture and `abiFilters` in your build.gradle matter.
2. Again, you should ask developers of libjsc, I can't answer your problem on behalf of them.
3. If you don't like the `libjsc`, you can switch back to the legacy libJavaScriptCore by building weex from source. Your can take the [travis file](https://github.com/apache/incubator-weex/blob/master/.travis.yml#L144) of Weex for an example.
